newsitem.title: UK: Shield up ahead of industry conference.
newsitem.headline: Shield up ahead of industry conference.

text.p: Shares in Shield Diagnostics Plc advanced for a fifth straight session, on optimism that the company's latest study on the company's test to predict heart attacks will be well received at an upcoming conference, dealers said on Friday.
By 0800 GMT, the shares were up 25p to 595.
So far this week, Shield shares have racked up gains of a stunning 45 percent amid talk the company was a takeover target.
British Biotech Plc and Drew Scientific Group Plc were named as possible suitors, but both denied interest in Shield.
"I don't think its bid talk that's driving the stock anymore," said one dealer. "It's this conference that people are talking about."
Shield will present data from the study at a conference in Florence on the link between heart attacks and Activated Factor Twelve, a blood clotting factor.
The company wasn't immediately available to comment.
